intro: Aporum subsessile, commonly known as the narrow-leafed aporum, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence structure consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. Aporum subsessile produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white, and it thrives in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
